snippet: If President-elect Donald J. Trump imposes steep tariffs on Chinese goods, he could harm the people he aims to help — American factory workers....
abstract: Pres-elect Donald Trump's campaign promise of putting in place punitive tariff on Chinese imports could result in making American jobs more vulnerable, by increasing costs to manufacturers; much of Trump's presidential campaign rhetoric failed to acknowledge how deeply dependent many American manufacturing jobs are on global supply chain.

byline.original: By PETER S. GOODMAN, NEIL GOUGH, SUI-LEE WEE and JACK EWING
byline.contributor: Peter S. Goodman reported from Holland, Mich.; Neil Gough from Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam; Sui-Lee Wee from Guangzhou, China; and Jack Ewing from Horgen, Switzerland. Julie Hirschfeld Davis, Zhang Tiantian and Emily Feng contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: If President-elect Donald J. Trump imposes steep tariffs on Chinese goods, he could harm the people he aims to help — American factory workers.

headline.main: Trump’s Tough Trade Talk Could Damage American Factories
headline.print_headline: Tough Talk on Global Trade Hits Close to Home
